page.title: 11BUSTON TUMULI,KINGS SUTTON.
page.content: IN 1910 IT WAS REPORTED TO THE "NORTH OXFORDSHIRE ACHAELOGICAL SOCIETY" THAT AN EXTENSIVE ROMANO-BRITISH SETTLEMENT HAD BEEN FOUND DURING{IRONSTONE MINING} AT THE ABOVE FARM.THE ROMANO-BRITISH SITE WAS OVERLYING AN OCCUPATION AND BURIAL SITE OF THE LATE NEOLITIC PERIOD.TWO TYPES OF{POTTERY}WERE FOUND ON THE SITE,SOME WAS ROUGH,HAND-MADE AND SOME WHEEL-MADE COMMON GREY POTTERY OF THE ROMANO-BRITISH PERIOD. TWO{TUMULI} WERE REMOVED FROM ONE OF THE FIELDS ON THE ASTROP-WARKWORTH ROAD.SEVERL{PITS}HAD ALSO BEEN EXCAVATED ON THE SITE VARYING FROM 2-3 FEET DEEP.EARTH IN THESE HOLLOWS CONTAINED ASHES,BITS OF POTTERY,BONES OF ANIMALS AND CALCINED STONE,IT WAS ALSO BLACKER THAN THE SOIL AROUND THEM. RATHER THAN THESE BEING{PIT-DWELLINGS}, IT IS THOUGHT THAT THEY WERE MORE LIKELY TO BE USED AS KILNS.
